Improving life for all by integrating the world
A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, opera

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’

Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to

remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

Improving life for all by integrating the world
A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, opera

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.

remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, opera

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.

remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

Container trade environment

the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

EBIT increased by 39% or USD 49m to USD 175m (USD 126m), and the EBIT margin increased to 4.8% (3.5%).
Managed by Maersk’s margins increased, mainly driven by Lead Logistics and Cold Chain Logistics. Fulfilled
by Maersk’s margins also improved year-on-year, mainly driven by Warehousing & E-Fulfilment and Middle
Mile. Transported by Maersk’s margins improved year-on-year with good profitability progress in First Mile.
Compared to Q1 2025, EBIT improved by USD 33m, and the EBIT margin improved by 0.7 percentage points.
Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

similar revenue levels as the prior year with growth of 0.9%.

Container trade environment
In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin
America, West-Central Asia and Africa. On the supply side, growth remained elevated in Q2, driven b

action in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

significant deliveries. At the end of the quarter, the nominal fleet was 8.2% larger than at the same time
in 2024, demolition was close to non-existent, while inactive capacity remained subdued. Amid regional and

Panama Canal Railway Company (Ocean) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) and adopted by the EU and additional Danish disclosure
On 1 April 2025, the Group acquired 100% of the shares in Panama Canal Railway Company (PCRC) from Canadian Pacific requirements for interim financial reporting of listed companies.
Kansas City Limited and the Lanco Group/Mi-Jack. PCRC operates a 76-km single-line railway adjacent to the Panama Canal, The accounting policies, judgements and significant estimates are consistent with those applied in the Annual Report 2024,
mainly facilitating cargo movement between the A

djacent to the Panama Canal, The accounting policies, judgements and significant estimates are consistent with those applied in the Annual Report 2024,

a broader range of services related to intermodal container movement to its global shipping customers. The total purchase Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates, which introduced requirements to assess when a currency is exchangeable into

From the acquisition date to 30 June 2025, PCRC contributed with revenue of USD 17m and an insignificant net profit.

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’

Management Review I Segments I Logistics & Services A.P. Moller - Maersk Interim Report Q2 | 7 August 2025 12
EBIT increased by 39% or USD 49m to USD 175m (USD 126m), and the EBIT margin increased to 4.8% (3.5%).
Managed by Maersk’s margins increased, mainly driven by Lead Logistics and Cold Chain Logistics. Fulfilled
by Maersk’s margins also improved year-on-year, mainly driven by Warehousing & E-Fulfilment and Middle
Mile. Transported by Maersk’s margins improved year-on-year with good profitability progress in First Mile.
Compared to Q1 2025, EBIT improved by USD 33m, and the EBIT margin improved by 0.7 percentage points.
Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

similar revenue levels as the prior year with growth of 0.9%.

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

Management Review I Highlights Q2 2025 A.P. Moller - Maersk Interim Report Q2 | 7 August 2025 3

in contrast to the prolonged weakness in domestic demand. With support from 2024 fiscal stimulus fading,
China is expected to contribute to the moderation in global growth in the second half of the year.
Container trade environment
In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin
America, West-Central Asia and Africa. On the supply side, growth remained elevated in Q2, driven b

action in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin
America, West-Central Asia and Africa. On the supply side, growth remained elevated in Q2, driven by
significant deliveries. At the end of the quarter, the nominal fleet was 8.2% larger than at the same time
in 2024, demolition was close to non-existent, while inactive capacity remained subdued. Amid regional and
month-on-month volatility resulting from the fluctuating tariffs, spot rates, measured by the Shanghai

on 21 March 2025, and withholding tax of USD 350m was paid during Q2 2025. Payment of dividends to shareholders does
not trigger taxes for the Group.

Market environment Containerized Freight Index (SCFI), declined in Q2 2025 compared to both Q1 2025 (-7%) and to Q2 2024
(-37%). The outlook for global container demand over the remainder of the year remains uncertain, shaped
by a rapidly evolving tariff landscape and high policy uncertainty in the US. Unless new major shocks occur,
global demand growth is expected to range between 2% and 4% for the full year.

Container trade environment
In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin
America, West-Central Asia and Africa. On the supply side, growth remained elevated in Q2, driven b

action in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin
America, West-Central Asia and Africa. On the supply side, growth remained elevated in Q2, driven by
significant deliveries. At the end of the quarter, the nominal fleet was 8.2% larger than at the same time
in 2024, demolition was close to non-existent, while inactive capacity remained subdued. Amid regional and

Management Review I Segments I Logistics & Services A.P. Moller - Maersk Interim Report Q2 | 7 August 2025 12
EBIT increased by 39% or USD 49m to USD 175m (USD 126m), and the EBIT margin increased to 4.8% (3.5%).
Managed by Maersk’s margins increased, mainly driven by Lead Logistics and Cold Chain Logistics. Fulfilled
by Maersk’s margins also improved year-on-year, mainly driven by Warehousing & E-Fulfilment and Middle
Mile. Transported by Maersk’s margins improved year-on-year with good profitability progress in First Mile.
Compared to Q1 2025, EBIT improved by USD 33m, and the EBIT margin improved by 0.7 percentage points.
Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

and offset by a decrease in Fulfilled by Maersk by USD 125m. Transported by Maersk maintained relatively
similar revenue levels as the prior year with growth of 0.9%.

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-

declined by 12% to 74k tonnes (84k tonnes). Revenue improved by 9.2% compared to Q1 2025.
Gross profit improved by 9.6% or USD 104m to USD 1.2bn (USD 1.1bn), resulting in a strong gross profit
margin of 32.5% (30.0%) with increases across all service models. Gross profit also increased sequentially
by 6.4% or USD 72m compared to Q1 2025.
EBITDA increased by 20% or USD 71m to USD 419m (USD 348m), and the EBITDA margin was 11.4% compared
to 9.6% in Q2 2024.

Management Review I Segments I Logistics & Services A.P. Moller - Maersk Interim Report Q2 | 7 August 2025 12
EBIT increased by 39% or USD 49m to USD 175m (USD 126m), and the EBIT margin increased to 4.8% (3.5%).
Managed by Maersk’s margins increased, mainly driven by Lead Logistics and Cold Chain Logistics. Fulfilled
by Maersk’s margins also improved year-on-year, mainly driven by Warehousing & E-Fulfilment and Middle
Mile. Transported by Maersk’s margins improved year-on-year with good profitability progress in First Mile.
Compared to Q1 2025, EBIT improved by USD 33m, and the EBIT margin improved by 0.7 percentage points.
Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.
Financial review 6M 2025
Revenue increased by USD 20m to USD 7.2bn (USD 7.1bn), driven by Managed by Maersk’s increase by USD 116m
and offset by a decrease in Fulfilled by Maersk by USD 125m. Transported by Maersk maintained relatively
similar revenue levels as the prior year with growth of 0.9%.
EBITDA increased by 31% to USD 802m (USD 614m), driven by cost control.
EBIT increased by 76% to USD 317m (USD 180m), driven by most products and supported by commercial
progress and continued cost control

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’

Compared to Q1 2025, EBIT improved by USD 33m, and the EBIT margin improved by 0.7 percentage points.
Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.
Financial review 6M 2025
Revenue increased by USD 20m to USD 7.2bn (USD 7.1bn), driven by Managed by Maersk’s increase by USD 116m
and offset by a decrease in Fulfilled by Maersk by USD 125m. Transported by Maersk maintained relatively
similar revenue levels as the prior year with growth of 0.9%.
EBITDA increased by 31% to USD 802m (USD 614m), driven by cost control.
EBIT increased by 76% to USD 317m (USD 180m), driven by most products and supported by commercial
progress and continued cost control

A increased by 31% to USD 802m (USD 614m), driven by cost control.
EBIT increased by 76% to USD 317m (USD 180m), driven by most products and supported by commercial
progress and continued cost control, resulting in an EBIT margin of 4.4% (2.5%).

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

The dividend for 2024 of DKK 1,120 per share of DKK 1,000, a total of DKK 17.4bn, equivalent to USD 2.5bn excluding
treasury shares was declared at the Annual General Meeting on 18 March 2025. Of this, USD 2.2bn was paid to shareholders
on 21 March 2025, and withholding tax of USD 350m was paid during Q2 2025. Payment of dividends to shareholders does
not trigger taxes for the Group.

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’

Container trade environment
In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

Improving life for all by integrating the world
A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, opera

.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers’
supply chains. As a global leader in logistics services, the company has 100,000+ customers, operates in
almost 130 countries and employs 100,000+ people. Maersk is committed to reaching net-zero emissions
by 2040 across the entire supply chain with new technologies, new vessels and alternative fuels. Management Review Financials

Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.

remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

The Interim Report has not been audited or reviewed by the company’s independent auditors.
Vincent Clerc Robert Mærsk Uggla
The Interim Report has been prepared in accordance with IAS 34 Interim Financial Reporting as
CEO Chair
adopted by the EU and additional Danish disclosure requirements for interim financial reporting
of listed companies.

Relieving Certificate
This is to confirm that Ms. Neha Jagtap, who was employed with Wastefull Insights as a
Software Development Engineer, has been relieved from her duties with effect from 7th
November 2025.
Neha has served the organisation from 1st January 2024 to 7th November 2025
and has completed all necessary handover formalities.
During her tenure, she was a valued member of our engineering team and contributed
significantly to the development of our robotic software and automation systems.
We thank her for her sincere efforts and contributions during her time with
us and wish her continued success in her future endeavours.

Container trade environment
In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

Gross profit improved by 9.6% or USD 104m to USD 1.2bn (USD 1.1bn), result

cy and margins. Air freight volumes
declined by 12% to 74k tonnes (84k tonnes). Revenue improved by 9.2% compared to Q1 2025.
Gross profit improved by 9.6% or USD 104m to USD 1.2bn (USD 1.1bn), resulting in a strong gross profit
margin of 32.5% (30.0%) with increases across all service models. Gross profit also increased sequentially
by 6.4% or USD 72m compared to Q1 2025.
EBITDA increased by 20% or USD 71m to USD 419m (USD 348m), and the EBITDA margin was 11.4% compared
to 9.6% in Q2 2024.

Management Review I Segments I Logistics & Services A.P. Moller - Maersk Interim Report Q2 | 7 August 2025 12
EBIT increased by 39% or USD 49m to USD 175m (USD 126m), and the EBIT margin increased to 4.8% (3.5%).
Managed by Maersk’s margins increased, mainly driven by Lead Logistics and Cold Chain Logistics. Fulfilled
by Maersk’s margins also improved year-on-year, mainly driven by Warehousing & E-Fulfilment and Middle
Mile. Transported by Maersk’s margins improved year-on-year with good profitability progress in First Mile.
Compared to Q1 2025, EBIT improved by USD 33m, and the EBIT margin improved by 0.7 percentage points.
Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.
Financial review 6M 2025
Revenue increased by USD 20m to USD 7.2bn (USD 7.1bn), driven by Managed by Maersk’s increase by USD 116m
and offset by a decrease in Fulfilled by Maersk by USD 125m. Transported by Maersk maintained relatively
similar revenue levels as the prior year with growth of 0.9%.
EBITDA increased by 31% to USD 802m (USD 614m), driven by cost control.
EBIT increased by 76% to USD 317m (USD 180m), driven by most products and supported by commercial
progress and continued cost control

EBIT increased by 39% or USD 49m to USD 175m (USD 126m), and the EBIT margin increased to 4.8% (3.5%).

by Maersk’s margins also improved year-on-year, mainly driven by Warehousing & E-Fulfilment and Middle
Mile. Transported by Maersk’s margins improved year-on-year with good profitability progress in First Mile.

Key initiatives in Q2
Logistics & Services continued executing its operational improvement strategy in Q2 2025, focusing
on targeted turnaround initiatives and cost optimisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asse

timisation. Contract Logistics achieved a sequential EBIT
improvement with double- digit revenue growth while implementing facility optimisation programmes to
reduce operational costs and improve asset utilisation.
Amid challenging market conditions, including tariff impacts and regulatory changes, Logistics & Services
remains focused on operational efficiency, cost optimisation and delivering sustainable profitability improve-
ments through disciplined execution of controllable initiatives.

Container trade environment
In Q2, global container demand is estimated to have increased between 3% and 5% year-on-year, challenging
the concerns of an immediate collapse in global trade after the US tariff announcements in April. The con-
traction in North American imports was more than offset by the strong import growth into Europe, Latin

Had the acquisition occurred on 1 January 2025, the impact on the Group’s revenue would have been USD 30m. The net
profit impact to the Group would have been insignificant. Acquisition-related costs of USD 5m have been recognised as
operating costs in the income statement of the Ocean segment and as cash flow from operating activities in the cash flow
statement.
The accounting for the business combination is considered provisional as at 30 June 2025, subject to finalisation of the
valuation of intangible assets.
